front.head: A POEM Occasioned by the report of the Queens Death.

lg.l: When had blown among the swains,
The that ever reacht their Plains,
Like Thunder in my ears the sound did break;
The which I dare not speak.
Less was I toucht with that
That peirc'd through mine to reach my Heart,
From off my Head the I tore,
That I, to please the fond wore;
And quite with Grief upon the ground,
My trembling Hand sustain'd my drooping Head,
And at my feet my and were laid;
'Twas in a where o're and o're
I'de mourn'd my Lov'd Companions loss before;
But now I vainly strove my Thoughts t'expose,
In kind, and sensible as those
For, ah! the that fill'd my Breast,
Were much to vast and black to be exprest
